As an AI language model, I cannot provide a personal view or advice, but I can tell you that it is challenging to entirely stop social media platforms from collecting your data as data is a crucial part of their business model. Social media platforms collect user data to provide personalized experiences and targeted advertising, which is how they generate revenue.

However, you can take some steps to limit the amount of data that social media platforms collect about you. Here are some recommendations:

1. Review your privacy settings: Go through the settings on your social media accounts to see what data they're collecting and sharing with third parties. You can limit the amount of data you're sharing with the platform and turn off features that track your activity across the internet.

2. Use ad blockers: Ad-blockers prevent ads from displaying on your device, which can limit how much data is collected about you. However, some social media platforms may limit your access if you use an ad-blocker.

3. Use virtual private networks (VPNs): VPNs encrypt your internet traffic, making it more difficult for social media platforms to collect data about you. Some VPNs also offer additional privacy features like ad-blocking and tracker blocking.

4. Be careful about what you share: Limit the amount of personal information you share on social media platforms. Avoid sharing sensitive information like your home address, phone numbers, and financial information.

Keep in mind that even if you take these steps to limit data collection and protect your privacy, you may not be able to entirely stop social media platforms from collecting some data about you.
